content: @WG-triage meeting time
so i guess it's just 1 person

i have two things on the agenda :

  • Updates on triagebot blocked on
  • Updates on dashboard
looking at the first one, i don't think t here are any updates. @Camelid (whenever online) let us know if there's any progress on it
and on the second point as well - there seems to be no updates. I'll try and see if I can bump those threads
that's it from agenda. So uhm - any concerns, opinions feedback on the triage from the last month?
(react with :+1: if none )
i'm not sure how do we do this effectively - but let's try something

side convo:
I'd stated I'm interested in doing more with dashboard, but I'll follow up more with that thread... not easy to find where's the source + setup dashboard software.
if during triage, you find that a reviewer is on many prs, add their names to the bottom of the report
maybe we can try and do some load-distribution in a better way

John Simon said:

side convo:
I'd stated I'm interested in doing more with dashboard, but I'll follow up more with that thread... not easy to find where's the source + setup dashboard software.

yeah thanks, i noticed it but there was no update on that after your comment

DPC said:

maybe we can try and do some load-distribution in a better way

there was some discussion of this in the latest compiler meeting
yeah this is sort of stemming from that
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/131828-t-compiler/topic/highfive.20review.20membership
though i haven't had a chat with them about it
I also haven't read that conversation in full, so will do later
next thing -
we have had this meeting at the same slot for almost a year now, so i'm wondering if it is time to reconsider and see maybe if there is a better time that can fit the team
i'll post a doodle link later that people can fill up with their available times and if we change I'll announce it at the next meeting
but, June's meeting will be in the same slot

thats it from my side
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
if you have anything to add for the next meeting you can do so here: https://hackmd.io/DZ2q4BlpRkSyf4RUxtil9g
Ok, that's it for the meeeting. Thanks for all the efforts and see you next month :smile:

DPC said:

looking at the first one, i don't think t here are any updates. Camelid (whenever online) let us know if there's any progress on it

I started implementing it, but there's more to do before it's ready. I'm planning to do that within the next week or so.
sure, take your time.
